summary: Email chain between FBI personnel discussing the status of digital evidence processing in the Epstein case, including inventory discrepancies and processing timelines for items seized from New York City and US Virgin Islands locations.

persons.name: SSA - FBI New York
persons.context: FBI agent in New York corresponding about Epstein evidence status, counting items and asking about processing timelines.

persons.name: NY CART Coordinator Senior Forensic Examiner
persons.context: Forensic examiner coordinating digital evidence processing for the Epstein case, providing spreadsheet and explaining inventory discrepancies.

connections.person2: NY CART Coordinator Senior Forensic Examiner
connections.description: FBI colleagues collaborating on digital evidence processing for the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Evidence status update
events.description: Forensic examiner sends spreadsheet with status of all digital evidence in Epstein case and explains inventory discrepancies.
personsInvolved: NY CART Coordinator Senior Forensic Examiner

events.title: Forwarded evidence discussion
events.description: FBI agent forwards evidence status email chain with note 'We have to nail this down'.

keyFacts: Total of 72 digital evidence items processed: 32 from NYC and 40 from USVI.
9 items outstanding including SSD from DVR, 2 Macs from USVI needing blacklight run, and RAID drives needing rebuilding.
Inventory discrepancies noted including 9 hard drives from NY apartment that were actually 3 duplicates of 3 drives.
Non-evidentiary items collected in error included voice recorders CART couldn't process and 10 software install CDs with no user data.
Relativity file dump anticipated to be complete in 1 to 1.5 weeks from July 6, 2020.
